access_token.description:
Access token of the SigNoz API. You can retrieve it from SigNoz UI
with Admin Role ([documentation](https://signoz.io/newsroom/launch-week-1-day-5/#using-access-token)).
Also, you can set it using environment variable SIGNOZ_ACCESS_TOKEN.

endpoint.description:
Endpoint of the SigNoz. It is the root URL of the SigNoz UI.
Also, you can set it using environment variable SIGNOZ_ENDPOINT. If not set, it defaults to http://localhost:3301.

http_max_retry.description:
Specifies the max retry limit for the HTTP requests made to SigNoz.
Also, you can set it using environment variable SIGNOZ_HTTP_MAX_RETRY. If not set, it defaults to 10.

http_timeout.description:
Specifies the timeout limit in seconds for the HTTP requests made to SigNoz.
Also, you can set it using environment variable SIGNOZ_HTTP_TIMEOUT. If not set, it defaults to 35.

alert_type.description: Type of the alert. Possible values are: METRIC_BASED_ALERT, LOGS_BASED_ALERT, TRACES_BASED_ALERT, and EXCEPTIONS_BASED_ALERT.

broadcast_to_all.description: Whether to broadcast the alert to all the alerting channels. By default, the alert is only sent to the preferred channels.

eval_window.description: The evaluation window of the alert. By default, it is 5m0s.

evaluation.description: Evaluation settings for the alert (JSON). Only used when schema_version is v2 or higher.

frequency.description: The frequency of the alert. By default, it is 1m0s.

id.description: Autogenerated unique ID for the alert.

labels.description: Labels of the alert. Severity is a required label.

group_by.description: Group by the alert. By default, it is empty, use '__all__' to get different notification for each unique parameters.

alert_states.description: For which AlertStates of the alert want to get renotified.

enabled.description: To enable the re-notification of the alert.

use_policy.description: Use policy in the alert. By default, it is false.

notification_settings.description: Notification settings for the alert. Only used when schema_version is v2 or higher.

preferred_channels.description: Preferred channels of the alert. By default, it is empty.

rule_type.description: Type of the alert. Possible values are: threshold_rule and promql_rule.

schema_version.description: Schema version of the alert. By default, it is v1. For v2+ schemas, additional fields like evaluation and notification_settings are supported.

severity.description: Severity of the alert. Possible values are: info, warning, error, and critical.

source.description: Source of the alert. By default, it is <SIGNOZ_ENDPOINT>/alerts.

update_at.description: Last update time of the alert.

version.description: Version of the alert. By default, it is v4.

block.description: Creates and manages alert resources in SigNoz.

id.description: Autogenerated unique ID for the dashboard.

source.description: Source of the dashboard. By default, it is <SIGNOZ_ENDPOINT>/dashboard.

updated_at.description: Last update time of the dashboard.

block.description: Creates and manages dashboard resources in SigNoz.

alert_type.description: Type of the alert. Possible values are: METRIC_BASED_ALERT, LOGS_BASED_ALERT, TRACES_BASED_ALERT, and EXCEPTIONS_BASED_ALERT.

broadcast_to_all.description: Whether to broadcast the alert to all the alert channels.

evaluation.description: Evaluation configuration of the alert as JSON.

labels.description: Labels of the alert. Severity is a required label.

preferred_channels.description: List of preferred channels of the alert. This is a noop if BroadcastToAll is true.

rule_type.description: Type of the Alert Rule for threshold. Possible values are: threshold_rule and promql_rule.

state.description: State of the alert. Possible values are: inactive, firing, pending, and disabled.

block.description: Fetches an alert from Signoz using its ID. The ID can be found in the URL of the alert in the Signoz UI.

id.description: Autogenerated unique ID for the dashboard.

source.description: Source of the dashboard. By default, it is <SIGNOZ_ENDPOINT>/dashboard.

block.description: Fetches a dashboard from Signoz using its id. The id can be found in the URL of the dashboard in the Signoz UI.
